title.narrative: CaSIPO (Care and Support to Improve Patient Outcomes)

description.narrative: The purpose of this program is to: provide care and support services to HIV positive individuals not yet eligible for ART; maximize the quality of life for the patients and their families; reduce the risk of onward HIV transmission to others; and implement comprehensive management of palliative care (PC) and other chronic conditions in line with the Primary Health Care re-engineering/revitalization. The new award will address key goals for PC scale up, including: 1) Continued TA for the scale up of the Integrated Access to Care and Treatment program; 2) Identification and implementation of gaps in PC; 3) Incorporation of PC into the public health care system with a specific focus on PHC; 4) Support for NDOH initiatives addressing PC-related policy and legislation, especially with regards to access to essential PC medicines; 5) Strengthening of PC-related educational and training initiatives, including curriculum development and implementation for health care professionals focusing at the PHC level; and 6) Support for existing collaborations, with a specific focus on community level, to sustain programs that complement facility-based PC service delivery.

participating-org.narrative: Hospice Palliative Care Association of South Africa

sector.narrative: Water supply and sanitation - large systems
